arch:property.oc:show_val: This locus is an outside surface. It is separated from the surface L164 by about 8-10cm of fill, L166. We first identified it as its own surface by identifying multiple rocks, pebbles, and flat-lying potsherds. We HAP sampled the surface in order to further analyze it. It was very well preserved in large sections, but on its edges it was poorly preserved. The surface produced a lot of pottery and bone, and some interesting pieces of lithic, as well as ground stones, all of which were unfortunately discarded before they could be saved. Lots of carbon was also found within the surface. It was a very interesting surface, bordered by the wall L157, L162, the ashy fill L167, and L159, all of which continue down past the end of this locus. It was a very good context not very far below the last surface. When excavating it, it seemed as though there were more surfaces directly beneath it, meaning that we could have unintentionally taken out more surfaces and fill than this one locus. It seems as though this surface was one in a series of tightly packed and very close-together surfaces.
lots of rocky inclusions, also pottery, lithic, and bone

arch:note.arch:string: Contexts excavated in trenches were recorded using the "locus system." A locus is any discrete three-dimensional entity excavated in a trench. The key to the locus system is the recognition that a locus is any one thing. Differences in soil composition or texture are therefore as important as, for example, the difference between a pit and a wall. If two entities were distinct, they were considered separate loci and were therefore assigned separate locus numbers. It should also be noted that every context excavated in a trench was given a locus number and thus the trench itself is made up completely of excavated loci.

arch:property.oc:show_val: Rocks and pottery and other such material worked into the ground together.
Very good context, fairly well-preserved. L169 is a lower surface and the fill was probably a tiny layer between these

oc:metadata.dc:title: Kenan Tepe: Area E / Trench 2 / Locus 168 (Locus)
